page.title: 02ECONOMICS IN MIDHURST
page.content: We have branches of the National Westminster, Barclays and Lloyds Banks and many building societies have offices.In recent years building societies have taken business from banks.Midhurst is a wealthy town so the number of bank and building society accounts is above the national average and still rising.More children have accounts.High property prices prevent first-time buyers from getting mortgages.Private borrowers get loans to make household purchases and businesses borrow to even out cash flows.Credit cards have affected building societies by making easy loans available.Rather than give out cash wage packets,more employers are paying straight into accounts or giving cheques as this reduces security problems.The number of investors is rising steadily.
